metadata.title: CVE-2021-4154 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
A use-after-free flaw was found in cgroup1_parse_param inkernel/cgroup/cgroup-v1.c in the Linux kernel's cgroup v1 parser. A localattacker with a user privilege could cause a privilege escalation byexploiting the fsconfig syscall parameter leading to a container breakoutand a denial of service on the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-4154` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic - 5.15.0-25.25
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-generic-64k - 5.15.0-25.25
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-aws - 5.15.0-1004.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-azure - 5.15.0-1003.4
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1007-gcp - 5.15.0-1003.6
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1009-ibm - 5.15.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-oracle - 5.15.0-1002.4
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-1005-raspi - 5.15.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency - 5.15.0-24.24
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-9-lowlatency-64k - 5.15.0-24.24
No subscription required
